title: Subcategories of the category of rings

blocks.name: srhmsubclem1
blocks.content: Lemma 1 for ~ srhmsubc . (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm srhmsubclem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cin(c2, crg)))
  -| wral(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  -| wceq(c1, cin(c2, c3))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
} = {
  3imtr4i(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c0, cin(c2, crg)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c0, c3)), wa(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c0, crg)))
  anim2i(wcel(c0, c2), wcel(c0, c3), wcel(c0, crg))
  vtoclri(s0, c0, c3, wcel(c0, crg), wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  eleq1(cv(s0), c0, crg)
  elin2(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  elin(c0, c2, crg)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, crg)
  diff.crg.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm srhmsubclem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c0 ∈(c2 ⋂ Ring))
  ⊣ ∀(s0 ∈ c3, s0 ∈ Ring)
  ⊣ c1 =(c2 ⋂ c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
} = {
  3imtr4i(c0 ∈ c1, c0 ∈(c2 ⋂ Ring), (c0 ∈ c2 ∧ c0 ∈ c3), (c0 ∈ c2 ∧ c0 ∈ Ring))
  anim2i(c0 ∈ c2, c0 ∈ c3, c0 ∈ Ring)
  vtoclri(s0, c0, c3, c0 ∈ Ring, s0 ∈ Ring)
  eleq1(s0, c0, crg)
  elin2(c0, c1, c2, c3)
  elin(c0, c2, crg)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, crg)
  diff.crg.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: srhmsubclem2
blocks.content: Lemma 2 for ~ srhmsubc . (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm srhmsubclem2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0))))
  -| wral(s0, c4, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  -| wceq(c3, cin(c0, c4))
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  eleqtrrd(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)), cin(c0, crg), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c2, cin(c0, crg)))
  srhmsubclem1(s0, c2, c3, c0, c4)
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)), cin(c0, crg)))
  ringcbas(cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)), c0, cfv(cringc, c0), c1, wcel(c0, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cringc, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)))
  id(wcel(c0, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm srhmsubclem2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3)→ c2 ∈(Base `(RingCat ` c0)))
  ⊣ ∀(s0 ∈ c4, s0 ∈ Ring)
  ⊣ c3 =(c0 ⋂ c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
} = {
  eleqtrrd(c2, (Base `(RingCat ` c0)), (c0 ⋂ Ring), (c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3))
  adantl(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3, c2 ∈(c0 ⋂ Ring))
  srhmsubclem1(s0, c2, c3, c0, c4)
  adantr(c0 ∈ c1, c2 ∈ c3, (Base `(RingCat ` c0))=(c0 ⋂ Ring))
  ringcbas((Base `(RingCat ` c0)), c0, (RingCat ` c0), c1, c0 ∈ c1)
  eqid((RingCat ` c0))
  eqid((Base `(RingCat ` c0)))
  id(c0 ∈ c1)
}

thm srhmsubclem3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))), wceq(co(c2, c5, c4), co(c2, cfv(chom, cfv(cringc, c0)), c4)))
  -| wral(s0, c6, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  -| wceq(c3, cin(c0, c6))
  -| wceq(c5, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  eqtr4d(co(c2, c5, c4), co(c2, cfv(chom, cfv(cringc, c0)), c4), co(c2, crh, c4), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))))
  ovmpt2d(s0, s1, c2, c5, c4, co(c2, crh, c4), c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1)), universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))), wceq(c5, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1)))))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))), wa(wceq(cv(s0), c2), wceq(cv(s1), c4)), wceq(co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1)), co(c2, crh, c4)))
  oveq12(cv(s0), c2, cv(s1), c4, crh)
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)), wcel(c2, c3))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)), wcel(c4, c3))
  ovexd(c2, crh, c4, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))))
  ringchom(c2, cfv(chom, cfv(cringc, c0)), c4, cfv(cringc, c0), c0, cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)), c1, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))))
  eqid(cfv(cringc, c0))
  eqid(cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)))
  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)))
  eqid(cfv(chom, cfv(cringc, c0)))
  sylan2(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0))), wcel(c2, c3))
  simpl(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))
  srhmsubclem2(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c6)
  sylan2(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)), wcel(c4, cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0))), wcel(c4, c3))
  simpr(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))
  srhmsubclem2(s0, c0, c1, c4, c3, c6)
  diff.co.s(s0, c2, crh, c4)
  diff.crh.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s1, c2, crh, c4)
  diff.crh.s(s1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c2, c3)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c4, c3)
  diff.wa.s(s1, wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3)))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s1, wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c3))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c2, c3)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c4, c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm srhmsubclem3(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3))→(c2[c5]c4)=(c2[(Hom `(RingCat ` c0))]c4))
  ⊣ ∀(s0 ∈ c6, s0 ∈ Ring)
  ⊣ c3 =(c0 ⋂ c6)
  ⊣ c5 =(s0 ∈ c3, s1 ∈ c3 ↦(s0[RingHom]s1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, c6)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
} = {
  eqtr4d((c2[c5]c4), (c2[(Hom `(RingCat ` c0))]c4), (c2[RingHom]c4), (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3)))
  ovmpt2d(s0, s1, c2, c5, c4, (c2[RingHom]c4), c3, c3, (s0[RingHom]s1), universe, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3)))
  a1i((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3)), c5 =(s0 ∈ c3, s1 ∈ c3 ↦(s0[RingHom]s1)))
  adantl((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3)), (s0 = c2 ∧ s1 = c4), (s0[RingHom]s1)=(c2[RingHom]c4))
  oveq12(s0, c2, s1, c4, crh)
  adantl(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3), c2 ∈ c3)
  adantl(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3), c4 ∈ c3)
  ovexd(c2, crh, c4, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3)))
  ringchom(c2, (Hom `(RingCat ` c0)), c4, (RingCat ` c0), c0, (Base `(RingCat ` c0)), c1, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3)))
  eqid((RingCat ` c0))
  eqid((Base `(RingCat ` c0)))
  simpl(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3))
  eqid((Hom `(RingCat ` c0)))
  sylan2(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3), c2 ∈(Base `(RingCat ` c0)), c2 ∈ c3)
  simpl(c2 ∈ c3, c4 ∈ c3)
  srhmsubclem2(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3, c6)
  sylan2(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3), c4 ∈(Base `(RingCat ` c0)), c4 ∈ c3)
  simpr(c2 ∈ c3, c4 ∈ c3)
  srhmsubclem2(s0, c0, c1, c4, c3, c6)
  diff.co.s(s0, c2, crh, c4)
  diff.crh.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s1, c2, crh, c4)
  diff.crh.s(s1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s0, c2 ∈ c3, c4 ∈ c3)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c2, c3)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c4, c3)
  diff.wa.s(s1, c0 ∈ c1, (c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c3))
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c0, c1)
  diff.wa.s(s1, c2 ∈ c3, c4 ∈ c3)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c2, c3)
  diff.wcel.s(s1, c4, c3)
}

blocks.name: srhmsubc
blocks.content: According to ~ df-subc , the subcategories ` ( Subcat `` C ) ` of a category ` C ` are subsets of the homomorphisms of ` C ` (see ~ subcssc and ~ subcss2 ). Therefore, the set of special ring homomorphisms (i.e. ring homomorphisms from a special ring to another ring of that kind) is a "subcategory" of the category of (unital) rings. (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm srhmsubc(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubc, cfv(cringc, c0))))
  -| wral(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  -| wceq(c4, cin(c0, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c4, c4, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  mpbir2and(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubc, cfv(cringc, c0))), wbr(c2, cssc, cfv(chomf, cfv(cringc, c0))), wral(hs0, c4, wa(wcel(cfv(cfv(ccid, cfv(cringc, c0)), cv(hs0)), co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs0))), wral(hs3, c4, wral(hs4, c4, wral(hs2, co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs3)), wral(hs1, co(cv(hs3), c2, cv(hs4)), wcel(co(cv(hs1), co(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs3)), cfv(cco, cfv(cringc, c0)), cv(hs4)), cv(hs2)), co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs4))))))))))
  mpbir2and(wcel(c0, c1), wbr(c2, cssc, cfv(chomf, cfv(cringc, c0))), wss(c4, cin(c0, crg)), wral(hs0, c4, wral(hs3, c4, wss(co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs3)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(chomf, cfv(cringc, c0)), cv(hs3))))))
  syl5eqss(c4, cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, c3), wcel(c0, c1))

  syl5sseqr(co(cv(hs0), crh, cv(hs3)), co(cv(hs0), cfv(chom, cfv(cringc, c0)), cv(hs3)), co(cv(hs0), crh, cv(hs3)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cv(hs3), c4))))
  ssid(co(cv(hs0), crh, cv(hs3)))

  simpl(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cv(hs3), c4)))
  ovmpt2d(s0, s1, cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs3), co(cv(hs0), crh, cv(hs3)), c4, c4, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1)), universe, wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cv(hs3), c4))))
  a1i(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cv(hs3), c4))), wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c4, c4, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1)))))
  adantl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cv(hs3), c4))), wa(wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs3))), wceq(co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1)), co(cv(hs0), crh, cv(hs3))))

  homffn(cfv(chomf, cfv(cringc, c0)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)), cfv(cringc, c0))
  fneq2d(cfv(chomf, cfv(cringc, c0)), cxp(cin(c0, crg), cin(c0, crg)), cxp(cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)), cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0))), wcel(c0, c1))
  sqxpeqd(cin(c0, crg), cfv(cbs, cfv(cringc, c0)), wcel(c0, c1))

  3eltr4d(cfv(cfv(ccid, cfv(cringc, c0)), cv(hs0)), co(cv(hs0), c2, cv(hs0)), cres(cid, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), co(cv(hs0), crh, cv(hs0)), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c4)))
  syl(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c4)), wcel(cres(cid, cfv(cbs, cv(hs0))), co(cv(hs0), crh, cv(hs0))), wcel(cv(hs0), crg))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cv(hs0), crg))
  sylbi(wcel(cv(hs0), c4), wcel(cv(hs0), crg), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(cv(hs0), c3)))

blocks.name: sringcat
blocks.content: The restriction of the category of (unital) rings to the set of special ring homomorphisms is a category. (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm sringcat(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), ccat))
  -| wral(s0, c3, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  -| wceq(c4, cin(c0, c3))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c4, c4, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
} = {
  subccat(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), cfv(cringc, c0), c2, wcel(c0, c1))
  eqid(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2))
  srhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm sringcat(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2)∈ Cat)
  ⊣ ∀(s0 ∈ c3, s0 ∈ Ring)
  ⊣ c4 =(c0 ⋂ c3)
  ⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ c4, s1 ∈ c4 ↦(s0[RingHom]s1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c4)
} = {
  subccat(((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2), (RingCat ` c0), c2, c0 ∈ c1)
  eqid(((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2))
  srhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
}

blocks.name: crhmsubc
blocks.content: According to ~ df-subc , the subcategories ` ( Subcat `` C ) ` of a category ` C ` are subsets of the homomorphisms of ` C ` (see ~ subcssc and ~ subcss2 ). Therefore, the set of commutative ring homomorphisms (i.e. ring homomorphisms from a commutative ring to a commutative ring) is a "subcategory" of the category of (unital) rings. (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm crhmsubc(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubc, cfv(cringc, c0))))
  -| wceq(c3, cin(c0, ccrg))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  srhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, ccrg, c3)
  rgen(s0, ccrg, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  crngring(cv(s0))
  diff.ccrg.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm crhmsubc(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 → c2 ∈(Subcat `(RingCat ` c0)))
  ⊣ c3 =(c0 ⋂ CRing)
  ⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ c3, s1 ∈ c3 ↦(s0[RingHom]s1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  srhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, ccrg, c3)
  rgen(s0, ccrg, s0 ∈ Ring)
  crngring(s0)
  diff.ccrg.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: cringcat
blocks.content: The restriction of the category of (unital) rings to the set of commutative ring homomorphisms is a category, the "category of commutative rings". (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm cringcat(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), ccat))
  -| wceq(c3, cin(c0, ccrg))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  subccat(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2), cfv(cringc, c0), c2, wcel(c0, c1))
  eqid(co(cfv(cringc, c0), cresc, c2))
  crhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c3)
}

thm cringcat(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ c1 →((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2)∈ Cat)
  ⊣ c3 =(c0 ⋂ CRing)
  ⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ c3, s1 ∈ c3 ↦(s0[RingHom]s1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  subccat(((RingCat ` c0)[|`cat]c2), (RingCat ` c0), c2, c0 ∈ c1)

blocks.name: drhmsubc
blocks.content: According to ~ df-subc , the subcategories ` ( Subcat `` C ) ` of a category ` C ` are subsets of the homomorphisms of ` C ` (see ~ subcssc and ~ subcss2 ). Therefore, the set of division ring homomorphisms is a "subcategory" of the category of (unital) rings. (Contributed by AV, 20-Feb-2020.)
blocks.origin:
thm drhmsubc(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, cfv(csubc, cfv(cringc, c0))))
  -| wceq(c3, cin(c0, cdr))
  -| wceq(c2, cmpo(s0, s1, c3, c3, co(cv(s0), crh, cv(s1))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  srhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cdr, c3)
  rgen(s0, cdr, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  drngring(cv(s0))
  diff.cdr.s(s0)
}

  ⊣ c3 =(c0 ⋂ DivRing)
  ⊣ c2 =(s0 ∈ c3, s1 ∈ c3 ↦(s0[RingHom]s1))
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c3)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
} = {
  srhmsubc(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, cdr, c3)
  rgen(s0, cdr, s0 ∈ Ring)
  drngring(s0)
  diff.cdr.s(s0)
}

  sselda(s0, c0, (Base ` c4), w0)

blocks.name: rhmsubc
blocks.content: According to ~ df-subc , the subcategories ` ( Subcat `` C ) ` of a category ` C ` are subsets of the homomorphisms of ` C ` (see ~ subcssc and ~ subcss2 ). Therefore, the set of unital ring homomorphisms is a "subcategory" of the category of non-unital rings. (Contributed by AV, 2-Mar-2020.)
blocks.origin:

  ⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈(Subcat `(RngCat ` c1)))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ c2)
  ⊣ c3 =(RngCat ` c1)
  ⊣ (w0 → c4 =(Ring ⋂ c1))
  ⊣ c0 =(RingHom |`(c4 × c4))
} = {
  mpbir2and(w0, c0 ∈(Subcat `(RngCat ` c1)), c0[C_cat](Homf `(RngCat ` c1)), ∀(hs0 ∈ c4,(((Id `(RngCat ` c1))` hs0)∈(hs0[c0]hs0)∧ ∀(hs3 ∈ c4, ∀(hs4 ∈ c4, ∀(hs2 ∈(hs0[c0]hs3), ∀(hs1 ∈(hs3[c0]hs4),(hs1[(< hs0, hs3 >[(comp `(RngCat ` c1))]hs4)]hs2)∈(hs0[c0]hs4))))))))
  3brtr4d(c0, cssc, (Homf `(RngCat ` c1)), (RingHom |`(c4 × c4)), (RngHomo |`((Rng ⋂ c1)×(Rng ⋂ c1))), w0)

  eqidd((Rng ⋂ c1), w0)
  a1i(w0, c0 =(RingHom |`(c4 × c4)))
  3eqtrd((Homf `(RngCat ` c1)), (RngHomo |`((Rng ⋂ c1)×(Rng ⋂ c1))), (Homf ` c3), (Hom ` c3), w0)
  fveq2d(chomf, (RngCat ` c1), c3, w0)
  eqcomd((RngCat ` c1), c3, w0)
  a1i(w0, c3 =(RngCat ` c1))
  rngchomfeqhom(c3, c1, (Base ` c3), c2, w0)
  eqtrd((Hom ` c3), (RngHomo |`((Rng ⋂ c1)×(Rng ⋂ c1))), (RngHomo |`((Base ` c3)×(Base ` c3))), w0)
  rngchomfval((Hom ` c3), (Base ` c3), c3, c1, c2, w0)

  jca((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c4), ((Id `(RngCat ` c1))` hs0)∈(hs0[c0]hs0), ∀(hs3 ∈ c4, ∀(hs4 ∈ c4, ∀(hs2 ∈(hs0[c0]hs3), ∀(hs1 ∈(hs3[c0]hs4),(hs1[(< hs0, hs3 >[(comp `(RngCat ` c1))]hs4)]hs2)∈(hs0[c0]hs4))))))

  ralrimivva(hs2, hs1, (hs0[c0]hs3), (hs3[c0]hs4), ((w0 ∧ hs0 ∈ c4)∧(hs3 ∈ c4 ∧ hs4 ∈ c4)), (hs1[(< hs0, hs3 >[(comp `(RngCat ` c1))]hs4)]hs2)∈(hs0[c0]hs4))

blocks.name: rhmsubccat
blocks.content: The restriction of the category of non-unital rings to the set of unital ring homomorphisms is a category. (Contributed by AV, 4-Mar-2020.)

blocks.name: srhmsubcALTVlem1

thm srhmsubcALTVlem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)), wcel(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cringcALTV, c0))))
  -| wral(s0, c4, wcel(cv(s0), crg))
  -| wceq(c3, cin(c0, c4))
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  eleqtrrd(c2, cfv(cbs, cfv(cringcALTV, c0)), cin(c0, crg), wa(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c2, cin(c0, crg)))
  srhmsubclem1(s0, c2, c3, c0, c4)
  adantr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wceq(cfv(cbs, cfv(cringcALTV, c0)), cin(c0, crg)))
  ringcbasALTV(cfv(cbs, cfv(cringcALTV, c0)), c0, cfv(cringcALTV, c0), c1, wcel(c0, c1))
  eqid(cfv(cringcALTV, c0))

  id(wcel(c0, c1))
}

blocks.name: srhmsubcALTV
blocks.content: According to ~ df-subc , the subcategories ` ( Subcat `` C ) ` of a category ` C ` are subsets of the homomorphisms of ` C ` (see ~ subcssc and ~ subcss2 ). Therefore, the set of special ring homomorphisms (i.e. ring homomorphisms from a special ring to another ring of that kind) is a "subcategory" of the category of (unital) rings. (Contributed by AV, 19-Feb-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)

Therefore, the set of commutative ring homomorphisms (i.e. ring homomorphisms from a commutative ring to a commutative ring) is a "subcategory" of the category of (unital) rings.   -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)

  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)

  crngring(cv(s0))

thm rhmsubcALTVlem3(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0) {

  ⊣ (w0 → c0 =(Ring ⋂ c1))
  ⊣ c2 =(RingHom |`(c0 × c0))

} = {
  a1ii(((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0)→((Id `(RngCatALTV ` c1))` s0)∈(s0[c2]s0)), d(s0, c0))
  3eltr4d(((Id `(RngCatALTV ` c1))` s0), (s0[c2]s0), (= |`(Base ` s0)), (s0[RingHom]s0), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  syl((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), (= |`(Base ` s0))∈(s0[RingHom]s0), s0 ∈ Ring)
  imp(w0, s0 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ Ring)

  eleq2d(s0, c0, (Ring ⋂ c1), w0)
  elinel1(s0, crg, c1)
  idrhm(s0, (Base ` s0))
  eqid((Base ` s0))
  fvmptd(hs0, (Id `(RngCatALTV ` c1)), s0, (= |`(Base ` s0)), (Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1)), (= |`(Base ` hs0)), universe, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  3syl((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), (Id `(RngCatALTV ` c1))=(hs0 ∈(Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1))↦(= |`(Base ` hs0))), c1 ∈ c3, ((RngCatALTV ` c1)∈ Cat ∧(Id `(RngCatALTV ` c1))=(hs0 ∈(Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1))↦(= |`(Base ` hs0)))))
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, c1 ∈ c3)
  rngccatidALTV(hs0, c1, c3, (RngCatALTV ` c1), (Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1)))
  eqid((RngCatALTV ` c1))
  eqid((Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1)))
  simpr((RngCatALTV ` c1)∈ Cat, (Id `(RngCatALTV ` c1))=(hs0 ∈(Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1))↦(= |`(Base ` hs0))))
  adantl((w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0), hs0 = s0, (= |`(Base ` hs0))=(= |`(Base ` s0)))
  reseq2d(cid, (Base ` hs0), (Base ` s0), hs0 = s0)
  fveq2(hs0, s0, cbs)
  eleqtrrd(s0, (Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1)), (c1 ⋂ Rng), (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  imp(w0, s0 ∈ c0, s0 ∈(c1 ⋂ Rng))
  syl6bi(w0, s0 ∈ c0, s0 ∈(c1 ⋂ Rng), s0 ∈(c1 ⋂ Ring))
  eleq2d(s0, c0, (c1 ⋂ Ring), w0)
  syl6eq(c0, (c1 ⋂ Ring), (Ring ⋂ c1), w0)
  incom(crg, c1)
  3imtr4i(s0 ∈(c1 ⋂ Ring), s0 ∈(c1 ⋂ Rng), (s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s0 ∈ Ring), (s0 ∈ c1 ∧ s0 ∈ Rng))
  anim2i(s0 ∈ c1, s0 ∈ Ring, s0 ∈ Rng)
  ringrng(s0)
  elin(s0, c1, crg)
  elin(s0, c1, crng)
  adantr(w0, s0 ∈ c0, (Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1))=(c1 ⋂ Rng))
  rngcbasALTV((Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1)), c1, c4, c3, w0)
  fveq2i(cbs, (RngCatALTV ` c1), c4)
  eqcomi((RngCatALTV ` c1), c4)
  resiexd((Base ` s0), universe, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  fvexd(cbs, s0, (w0 ∧ s0 ∈ c0))
  3anidm23(w0, s0 ∈ c0, (s0[c2]s0)=(s0[RingHom]s0))
  rhmsubcALTVlem2(s0, c0, s0, c2, c1, c3, c4, w0)
  diff.hs0.c(s0)
  diff.hs0.c((= |`(Base ` s0)))
  diff.hs0.c((Base `(RngCatALTV ` c1)))

blocks.name: rhmsubcALTV
blocks.content: According to ~ df-subc , the subcategories ` ( Subcat `` C ) ` of a category ` C ` are subsets of the homomorphisms of ` C ` (see ~ subcssc and ~ subcss2 ). Therefore, the set of unital ring homomorphisms is a "subcategory" of the category of non-unital rings. (Contributed by AV, 2-Mar-2020.) (New usage is discouraged.)
